item.title: helpful
item.description:
a reminder to clean myself up, take my toys out!
if i'm intensely subby, i won't want to assume/do things without asking - & brain fog can make me forget these are the next steps to take at all!
be direct & open
i can get in my head if things feel fake or put on - just be yourself & try to be as direct/upfront as you can - & i'll try to do the same.
debriefing!
i want to know ALL of your thoughts. what did you like? what didn't you like? specificity is good here. please god no veer away from flattering/intense praise!
if we are both feeling good this can be in the moment - if i'm nonverbal or dropping this can be difficult - in those cases talking about it later and/or the next day is great
point to specific elements in play!
ask questions, let me know if you want clarification, if things could be different for another time
let me do the same
when done well this brings security to playing with you & helps me understand how to move forward. eliminates lots of anxieties!
gendering <3
if it was a scene involving misgendering - this includes anything related to continued use of solely she/her pronouns or referring to me as a girl - this is super helpful & grounding. reminds me you don't see me like that & that you recognise me as a person etc. if you make a mistake, that's totally fine. happens a lot! best thing to do is not to make it a big deal - it won't be unless it's turned into one!
pasted in frm kinkdiscussion self reference etccccccc
i need to talk through intense scenes. i need to know that the dom enjoyed themselves, to get confirmation that they were invested in the scene and that they enjoyed it. the space to ask questions, to go over things that i like/didn’t like. to ask what they did! sometimes doms don’t want to go over it in too much detail / are too shut off to be able to accept aftercare and that’s super fine but it’s important to me to be able to at least check on how they are feeling because otherwise i’ll be nervous about it and then probably drop lmfao. i really struggle when play partners aren’t open about how they feel - even if they didn’t like something it’s so much better when things are open & upfront. makes me feel safer to know they will tell me when something doesn’t align, or if something made them uncomfortable.

item.title: nonverbal
item.description:
firstly - this doesn't necessarily mean that i am dropping, or that i will! it can happen just as a result of intense subbiness and the transition out of it.

if you've found your way here, i'm likely not making much sense. my apologies! please don't be afraid, i am not angry at you nor am i trying to ignore you.

pasted in from kink discuss - for own reference not for here:
i go nonverbal a lot, often mid scene if it gets intense and that can carry over into aftercare - one that that works for me incredibly well is when a couple of people have read over vc, or talked at me. it’s really useful to me to have someone there and present but not necessarily forcing a response from me & helps me get my brain back to closer to where it needs to be to be able to talk or go through things. listening to or investing in my hyperfixations also helps a lot - listening to certain soundtracks or songs on repeat helps bring me back to a state where i can break through some of the dissociation.
i drop really quite bad. a lot of play that i do incorporates stuff that i have ptsd in relation too, and not getting proper aftercare can really fuck with things (though even with proper aftercare drops can still hit bad). i need to talk through intense scenes. i need to know that the dom enjoyed themselves, to get confirmation that they were invested in the scene and that they enjoyed it. the space to ask questions, to go over things that i like/didn’t like. to ask what they did! sometimes doms don’t want to go over it in too much detail / are too shut off to be able to accept aftercare and that’s super fine but it’s important to me to be able to at least check on how they are feeling because otherwise i’ll be nervous about it and then probably drop lmfao. i really struggle when play partners aren’t open about how they feel - even if they didn’t like something it’s so much better when things are open & upfront. makes me feel safer to know they will tell me when something doesn’t align, or if something made them uncomfortable.
i have a lot of guilt associated with what i call the ‘consequences’ of playing with me, because i know that aftercare with me can take quite a long time if i am dropping or if ptsd sets in (if we were fucking around with trauma related stuff). i only do it with people i trust regardless, but i still find it quite difficult to accept that people understand that aftercare is a part of engaging in those kinks -
my brain is geared to the idea that my play partners are not interested in what is happening & want to be done with it immediately - and my brain likes to cling to the ideas it’s decided to attach to - so being shown otherwise is always helpful.
i do not usually really want lots of cuddles/kisses/lots of praise.
genuine comments on what went well in the scene, on things they enjoyed or liked - very helpful. heavy praise makes me feel too much like i am filling a role once again, which is the opposite of what i want.
affirmations are just great. i’ve talked abt them a lot but reaffirming that they don’t view me as fragile if i have a ptsd moment or drop - that they want to play again and it hasn’t changed their view of me / it doesn’t make them think of me as weak is helpful. affirming that i enjoyed it, that i had fun and they have not hurt me or done anything i didn’t want etc. affirming that those aren’t their actual views - after mikey did some intenseish appearance degradation in on theme the aftercare was just very silly talks about what he was actually thinking during the scene & how misaligned it was with the things he was saying. very helpfu

item.title: please god no
item.description:
referring to me in a childlike manner
especially if i am dropping, try to avoid throwing in words like 'little', 'baby' or anything of the sort, even if you don't think those relate to that. in that headspace this can bring up PTSD related things and make it worse xx
orders related to food
i know this is something lots of subs like, i understand how helpful this can be! but please for the love of god. tell me to get water or smth instead!! can interact with disordered eating behaviours. at most, a gentle reminder if i have snacks or food around - but please don't make it an obligation.
intense praise!
this can feel flattering, or fake. reassurances are super helpful, if they are accurate, but please don't say things for the sake of it or go overboard because you want me to feel better. vagueness, or fawning can increase the anxieties you may be trying to quell, or squash trust that you would tell me if something was wrong <3
heavy praise makes me feel too much like i am filling a role once again, which is the opposite of what i want.
telling me to shush/shut up/or jokes at my expense
this can be context dependant, but in general, i take things very literally right after a scene - so it's something to be mindful of if that's not your intended reaction.
demanding audible/understandable responses and/or giving lots of tasks i can't complete
often my speech will be unintelligible following play & i may not be able to move very much! demanding or placing expectations on those things will cause them to take longer to return & can lead to feelings of disappointment & failure <3
sexualising emotional responses
once we have moved into aftercare, there needs to be a clear separation between play & us as people. if i'm crying or unable to speak, sexualising this can trigger PTSD responses
using the clicker on the vc soundboard is also v unhelpful - will make me more subby and that is the opposite of the goal here!
well aware lots of subs are okay with horny aftercare but for whatever time we are remaining horny - i'm gna need some time after that to get back to normal.

item.title: README
item.description:
hi! this is an aftercare document for indi/fairy/sol! if you're reading this then hopefully this can help to explain what might happen on my end, what sort of things are helpful, and how things can play out. oftentimes i will get nonverbal in aftercare, or may just be unintelligible - so i hope this can help communicate in my absence of ability!
aftercare is a big deal - and i struggle to accept it or to feel like it is not a burden to engage it. i hope this can help you gage what it might be like, and come into things with an informed perspective on if you actually want to play with me and the extent you want to take things to <3.
firstly it's probably good to have a look at times i might need it! generally, i do prefer these forms of play, but as they feel more intense that means the later steps will be the same.
while there are some things that are going to be helpful, or a please god no in most situations, it can also take different routes, from chill, to dropping, to times that my PTSD may rear it's head, & if the nonverbal headspace comes into play.

item.title: times i might need it!
item.description:
aftercare can look different depending on what we engaged with in the play! an understanding of this will build the more we play, but this is for a rough guide.
examples of times it's definitely useful:

voiceplay - especially if consistently on vc for extended periods
cucking &/or plays that involve other subs
scenes that might pull from my PTSD, or trauma related play
intense painplay
overstim play and/or multiple goes of cumming <3
appearance degradation
TBA
if the play is mostly roleplay based, text based etc, it's less likely for me to experience a drop or need extensive aftercare. that's not to say there won't be exceptions, but it pulls on my emotions in a different way <3
